analyzed: bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan ba sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of effort, from ‚Äòeffort‚Äô up to ‚Äòthey do not falsely project that patience.‚Äô

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva who practices the perfection of effort in this way takes hold of all six perfections.üîΩTherefore, he is called 'one who has donned the great armor.'

original: de'i phyir go cha chen po bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs phar byed pa'i go cha bgos pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir go cha chen po bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs phar byed pa'i go cha bgos pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to here, it shows donning the armor that perfects the six perfections when accomplishing the perfection of effort.

analyzed: de la brtson 'grus kyang rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: de la go cha'i brtson 'grus ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun @153b sum tshogs par bya ba'i sems dang po bskyed cing cha ba'o //
translated: Armor effort is the first generation and development of the thought to perfect ones own and others aims.

original: sems can gyi don spyod pa'i brtson 'grus ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don spyod pa'i brtson 'grus ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa ste /

original: de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe sbyin pa yongs su gtong bas sems can gyi don byed pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //

translated: Thus, when one is engaged in effort, the benefit of living beings through the practice of generosity is the perfection of generosity for one who is engaged in the perfection of effort.

analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas ma yin gyi /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba mi gtong ba nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i yid dam bcas pa las ma nyams pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: but with attention associated with the knowledge of all things. One does not give up the vow to attain supreme enlightenment. Thus, one perfects the transcendence of morality, as above.

original: de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang brtson 'grus su bya ba'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa la bzod pa dang / mos pa dang / de la brten cing mi 'jigs mi skrag pa nyid bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang brtson 'grus su bya ba'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa la bzod pa dang / mos pa dang / de la brten cing mi 'jigs mi skrag pa nyid bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: When one thus exerts effort, one is patient with, and believes in, the nonapprehension of the exertion of effort and of the things to be made effortless. One is not frightened or terrified by that. This is the transcendence of patience.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe sems can thams cad kyi don du brtson 'grus rtsom pa nyams par yang mi byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i tshe sems can thams cad kyi don du brtson 'grus rtsom pa nyams par yang mi byed /
translated: Likewise, when one is making an effort, one does not let the effort for the sake of all beings decline, nor does one make it too intense.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus rtsom pa na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas sems ma yengs shing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa nyid bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogsüîΩpa yin no //

translated: This is the perfection of meditative concentration.

analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus rtsom pa na shes rab kyis chos thams cad la sgyu mar byas pa'i 'du shes nye bar gnas pa dang / brtson 'grus des rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / brtson 'grus de yang mi dmigs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang sems can thams cad dang thun mong @154a * // du byas shing /
translated: Likewise, when undertaking perseverance, the perception of all phenomena as illusions through wisdom is present, and through that perseverance one does not become conceited, and that perseverance is also not apprehended, and those roots of virtue are made common to all sentient beings,üîΩand they are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of concentration, from ‚Äòthe four concentrations‚Äô up to ‚Äòthe four formless absorptions,‚Äô they do not apprehend the four concentrations, up to they do not apprehend the four formless absorptions.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: The venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of meditative stability in this way, they take hold of all six perfections.üîΩTherefore, they are called ‚Äòthose who have donned the great armor.‚Äô

original: de'i phyir go cha chen po bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i go cha bgos pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir go cha chen po bgos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par sgrub pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i go cha bgos pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, it has been shown that when the perfection of meditative stability is accomplished completely, the armor that makes the six perfections complete is donned.

original: de la bsam gtan yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In this regard, meditative stability is of three kinds:

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog cing sems zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i bsam gtan dang / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: meditative stability that cultivates the antidotes to the afflictions with a mind that is nonconceptual, calm, and very calm; meditative stability that accomplishes excellent qualities; and meditative stability that accomplishes the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog cing sems zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i bsam gtan ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te /
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog cing sems zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i bsam gtan ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas te /
translated: The concentration of the antidote to the afflictions is the concentration of one who, without conceptualizing anything, pacifies and completely pacifies the mind and who cultivates the antidote to the afflictions, abiding in nonconceptual concentration.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams la g-yeng ba'i sems rnams zhi bar byas nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po mi sdug pa dang / byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa bsgom pa'o //

translated: Having pacified the distracted mind with regard to the afflictions of passion, etc., one cultivates the antidotes to the afflictions, such as the unattractiveness of the body, loving-kindness, and dependent origination.

original: yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan ni ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig tu bzhag pa'i bsam gtan bsgom pa las mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can rnams thob par 'gyur ba'o //

translated: The concentration of the accomplishment of good qualities is the attainment of the special qualities such as the superknowledges, etc., through the cultivation of concentration that is one-pointedly fixed on its object.

translated: The concentration of accomplishing the aims of sentient beings is the fulfillment of the hopes of sentient beings by the power of meditation, such as the rain of various jewels and so on falling from the sky.

translated: When one practices concentration in this way, by the giving of concentration that accomplishes the aims of sentient beings,üîΩthe fulfillment of the hopes of sentient beings is the perfection of concentration.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i yid dam bcas pa las ma nyams pa nyid tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i yid dam bcas pa las ma nyams pa nyid tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The perfection of morality is fulfilled by not transgressing one's vow to attain omniscience, as before.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan byed pa'i tshe chos zab mos mi skrag pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su len pa nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan byed pa'i tshe chos zab mos mi skrag pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su len pa nyid /
translated: Similarly, when one is practicing concentration, the perfection of patience is fulfilled by not being frightened by the profound Dharma, by not minding harm done by others, and by enduring all sufferings.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i tshe /

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: When one is practicing concentration, the perfection of patience is fulfilled.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When one is practicing concentration,

analyzed: le lo'i dbang du ma gyur cing brtson 'grus ma nyams pa nyid brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gong du smos pa rnam pa gsum las gang yang rung ba cig bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When one is practicing any one of the three kinds of concentration mentioned above,

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba'i sems rtse gcig tu gzhag pa las ma nyams shing /

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yid la byed pas sems gud du ma yengs pa nyid bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bsgom pa'i tshe /

analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur 'du shes nye bar 'jog cing /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa shar dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, furthermore, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, from ‚Äòthe perfection of wisdom‚Äô up to ‚Äòthe perfection of wisdom,‚Äô

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa shar dva ti'i bu rnam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang @155a * //
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti, this is the perfection of the mind of bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas endowed with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ldan pa'i sems kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag dang / sems can dang / byang chub la mtshan mar mi byed /üîΩmi dmigs pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: ldan pa'i sems kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag dang / sems can dang / byang chub la mtshan mar mi byed / mi dmigs pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /
translated: They do not take sentient beings and enlightenment as signs,üîΩand do not apprehend them. This is the great armor of the six perfections

translated: This teaches the donning of the armor that accomplishes the perfection of the six perfections.

analyzed: de la shes rab kyang rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: phyir ro // dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni dga' ba la chags pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid sngar bshad pa de lta bu dang lngan pa'i bsam gtan yongs su rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes bya ba'i

original: yid mi bde ba med par gyur zin pas bsam gtan bzhi pa 'di la spang mi dgos pa'i phyir yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba snga nas kyang nub pas zhes bya ba bshad do //

translated: The meaning of the above is that, with the mind spontaneously present, one has complete equanimity and complete mindfulness.

original: de la byams pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la byams pa la rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa ni sa brgyad yan chad mtshan ma med cing rtsol ba med de /

analyzed: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems rgya chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byams pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /

analyzed: tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni sems can tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

original: yongs su rdzogs pa shin tu bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu sems can la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang / don dam par 'khor gsum yongs su dag par bsgom pa goms par byas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'jig rten chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /

analyzed: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa'i phyogs bcu rgyas par bkang ste /

translated: ‚ÄúIt is directed‚Äù means that it is directed to the realm of sentient beings.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is cultivated‚Äù means that it is cultivated in a way that is free of the three spheres.

original: dang po sems ma goms pa'i tshe bdag gang la byams pa'i mi de la sngon pas kyang lhag par byams pa bsgoms la /üîΩde'i 'og tu de bas 'bring du byams pa la rab tu byams par bsgom /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu cung zad kyang mi byams pa la cung zad byams par bsgom ste /

translated: In the same way, you should meditate on love for the people in a house, the people in a city, the people in a country, the people in a region, the people in a kingdom, the people in a continent, the people in the four continents, the people in a great trichiliocosm, and then for all sentient beings in the limitless, infinite world systems in the ten directions.

translated: The phrase ‚Äúan attitude of great joy‚Äù and so forth teaches the cultivation of immeasurable joy.

original: dga' ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dga' ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Joy is of three kinds:

original: sems can bde zhing 'byor @160b pa rnams la dmigs nas dga' ba dang / bdag gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas dga' ba dang / dam pa'i chos rtogs shing nyams 'og tu chud pa'i dga' ba'o //

analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa na /

translated: The equanimity of being unstained by the eight worldly concerns gain and loss, pleasure and pain, fame and disgrace, praise and blame and happiness and suffering

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i btang snyoms te /
